Description: Papyrus; Hieroglyphic and Hieratic text. The 'Tanis Sign Papyrus'. Large fragment in bottom right is now numbered 10672B: Demotic text with Greek on other side.
Curator's comments: Published in Griffith and Petrie, Two Hieroglyphic Papyri from Tanis (London, 1889). See Favard-Meeks in Brissaud and Zivie-Coche: Tanis 1987-1997 (1998) p.126. BM OP 60, p.15 plate g 10672B to be published by Jasnow and Ryholt.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380872) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380872)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: brittle, fragmentary, carbonised Black ink Adhered: gelatin (spots, cracked) Transferred to horizontal storage 30 DEC 94 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: E Curatorial condition comment: poor
